str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A precursor, forerunner, advance guard. From the alternate of protrecho; a runner ahead, i.e. Scout.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From tasso; regular arrangement, i.e. fixed succession, official dignity.
Melchizedek, king and priest of Salem. Of Hebrew origin; Melchisedek, a patriarch.
